alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 14 at 4:06PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a glacier-dammed lake outburst continues. * WHERE...Kenai River downstream of the bridge in Soldotna. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Big Eddy subdivision roads will have 0.5 to 1.0 feet of water over top and most low lying areas in subdivision will be inundated. Isolated homes near the Beaver Creek outlet may see some water in low lying parts of yards. Pillars boat launch will be nearly underwater * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 404 PM AKDT, The Skilak Glacier Lake is done releasing at this time, however water levels will remain high through Friday morning. - For Kenai River at Soldotna: At 3:00pm the stage was 11.49 feet. Flood Stage is 12.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 11.4 feet is expected around 10:00pm Thursday. - Inherent uncertainty in initial glacier lake volume will result in varying crest height and timing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
